name: Extract layer (with decreasing number of dimensions)

controls.name: lastCoordinate
controls.caption: Last coordinate T
controls.description:
For N-dimensional source, the result will be (N−1)-dimensional layer of the source, where all last coordinates #(N−1) have the given value T. For example, if N=3 (3D matrix), T specifies the z-coordinate of 2-dimensional layer.
T value can be negative; in this case, it is added to the last dimension of the matrix. For example, T=−1 means extracting the last (rear) layer of 3D-matrix or the last (bottom) row of 2D-matrix.
Note: if N=1, the source (1-dimensional array) is returned without changes.
